brief_summary.textblock:
OBJECTIVES:

      Determine the relationship between serum calcium concentrations and parathyroid hormone
      secretion in patients with pseudohypoparathyroidism.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of the Regulation of Parathyroid Hormone Secretion in Pseudohypoparathyroidism

detailed_description.textblock:
PROTOCOL OUTLINE:

      Patients are tested for parathyroid hormone response following sequential graded intravenous
      infusions of sodium citrate and calcium gluconate.  Assays include ionized calcium and
      intact parathyroid hormone.

criteria.textblock:
PROTOCOL ENTRY CRITERIA:

        --Disease Characteristics-- Pseudohypoparathyroidism, i.e.: Renal resistance to
        parathyroid hormone OR Albright hereditary osteodystrophy No other illness unless related
        to pseudohypoparathyroidism No pregnant women

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.
